items.title: Detect string formatting with number
items.body:
Is there a rule I need to set?

```bash
echo "print 'asd %s' % 1\nfoo()" > test.py
flake8 test.py
test.py:2:1: F821 undefined name 'foo'
```

Versions:
```
flake8 --version
3.6.0 (flake8_pep3101: 1.2.1, flake8_quotes: 2.1.1, mccabe: 0.6.1, pycodestyle: 2.4.0, pyflakes: 2.0.0) CPython 2.7.15 on Darwin```

items.title: false positive modulo operator
items.body:
```python
if var % 50 == 0:
    do something
```
leads to "S001 found module formatter" which would be used in
```python
var = u'a %s' % u'string'
```
or
```python
var = u'a %s and %s' % (u'string', u'another string')
```
or via a variable
```python
msg = u'string'
var = u'a %s' % msg
```
or multiple variables
```python
msg1 = u'string'
msg2 = u'another string'
var = u'a %s and %s' % (msg1, msg2)
```

i guess its work fiddling around with the regex to parse the modulo operator correct.
sadly i am not good at that ...

items.title: false positive fail on "+="
items.body:
var += 1 leads to "S001 found module formatter"

wrongly, i guess.

items.title: False positives on integer division
items.body:
the following code is causing the linter to fail:

```python
r = i % 4 * 64
g = i % 8 * 32
b = i % 16 * 16
```

see:

* https://github.com/collective/collective.cover/blob/master/src/collective/cover/testing.py#L107-L109
* https://travis-ci.org/collective/collective.cover/jobs/232977017

items.title: Cannot read from stdin
items.body:
It seems that I cannot lint a file passed to flake8 using stdin.

Steps to reproduce:

```sh
$ virtualenv -p python2.7 /tmp/venv-$RANDOM
Running virtualenv with interpreter /usr/bin/python2.7
New python executable in /tmp/venv-15675/bin/python2.7
Also creating executable in /tmp/venv-15675/bin/python
Installing setuptools, pip, wheel...done.

$ source /tmp/venv-15675/bin/activate

(venv-15675) $ pip install flake8-pep3101==1.0
Collecting flake8-pep3101==1.0
Collecting flake8>=3.0 (from flake8-pep3101==1.0)
  Using cached flake8-3.3.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting enum34; python_version < "3.4" (from flake8>=3.0->flake8-pep3101==1.0)
  Using cached enum34-1.1.6-py2-none-any.whl
Collecting configparser; python_version < "3.2" (from flake8>=3.0->flake8-pep3101==1.0)
Collecting pyflakes<1.6.0,>=1.5.0 (from flake8>=3.0->flake8-pep3101==1.0)
  Using cached pyflakes-1.5.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting mccabe<0.7.0,>=0.6.0 (from flake8>=3.0->flake8-pep3101==1.0)
  Using cached mccabe-0.6.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Collecting pycodestyle<2.4.0,>=2.0.0 (from flake8>=3.0->flake8-pep3101==1.0)
  Using cached pycodestyle-2.3.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Installing collected packages: enum34, configparser, pyflakes, mccabe, pycodestyle, flake8, flake8-pep3101
Successfully installed configparser-3.5.0 enum34-1.1.6 flake8-3.3.0 flake8-pep3101-1.0 mccabe-0.6.1 pycodestyle-2.3.1 pyflakes-1.5.0

(venv-15675) $ touch a.py

(venv-15675) $ cat a.py| flake8 -
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/tmp/venv-15675/bin/flake8", line 11, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/tmp/venv-15675/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/main/cli.py", line 16, in main
    app.run(argv)
  File "/tmp/venv-15675/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/main/application.py", line 328, in run
    self._run(argv)
  File "/tmp/venv-15675/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/main/application.py", line 316, in _run
    self.run_checks()
  File "/tmp/venv-15675/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/main/application.py", line 246, in run_checks
    self.file_checker_manager.run()
  File "/tmp/venv-15675/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/checker.py", line 319, in run
    self.run_serial()
  File "/tmp/venv-15675/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/checker.py", line 303, in run_serial
    checker.run_checks()
  File "/tmp/venv-15675/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/checker.py", line 573, in run_checks
    self.run_ast_checks()
  File "/tmp/venv-15675/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/checker.py", line 487, in run_ast_checks
    for (line_number, offset, text, check) in runner:
  File "/tmp/venv-15675/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8_pep3101.py", line 19, in run
    tree = ast.parse(lines)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/ast.py", line 37, in parse
    return compile(source, filename, mode, PyCF_ONLY_AST)
TypeError: expected a readable buffer object
```

On Python 3.5 it also doesn't work:

```sh
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/tmp/venv-19888/bin/flake8", line 11, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/tmp/venv-19888/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/main/cli.py", line 16, in main
    app.run(argv)
  File "/tmp/venv-19888/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/main/application.py", line 328, in run
    self._run(argv)
  File "/tmp/venv-19888/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/main/application.py", line 316, in _run
    self.run_checks()
  File "/tmp/venv-19888/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/main/application.py", line 246, in run_checks
    self.file_checker_manager.run()
  File "/tmp/venv-19888/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/checker.py", line 319, in run
    self.run_serial()
  File "/tmp/venv-19888/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/checker.py", line 303, in run_serial
    checker.run_checks()
  File "/tmp/venv-19888/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/checker.py", line 573, in run_checks
    self.run_ast_checks()
  File "/tmp/venv-19888/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/checker.py", line 487, in run_ast_checks
    for (line_number, offset, text, check) in runner:
  File "/tmp/venv-19888/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8_pep3101.py", line 19, in run
    tree = ast.parse(lines)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.5/ast.py", line 35, in parse
    return compile(source, filename, mode, PyCF_ONLY_AST)
TypeError: compile() arg 1 must be a string, bytes or AST object
```

When using 0.6 it does seem to work, but I would like to be able to use the latest and greatest.

items.title: Add Framework :: Flake8 classifier to setup.py
items.body: There is a `Framework :: Flake8` [classifier](https://pypi.python.org/pypi?%3Aaction=list_classifiers) that you can use for flake8 plugins.

items.title: pep8 has been renamed to pycodestyle
items.body:
The pep8 package has been renamed to [pycodestyle](https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle). So after installing latest flake8 (that requires pycodestyle), installing flake8-pep3101 and running flake8, I get the following error:

```
ImportError: No module named 'pep8'
```

items.title: False identification of query placeholders within strings
items.body:
``` python
query = """
    SELECT some_function(
        %(foo_id)s
    )
    FROM table
    """
query_params = {
    'foo_id': 123,
}
cursor.execute(query, query_params)
```

Flake8-pep3101 will complain about the percent sign in the string, but there's no remedy that:
- I can't replace the percent signs with anything else
- I cannot embed a `# noqa` within a multiline string
- I don't want to disable this check for the entire file
- I would rather not break my string just for the sake of an overeager linter

Weirdly, if I do `SELECT some_function(%(foo_id)s)` instead of having the parameter on a new line, the linter will not complain; this is not a suitable solution though, as my actual query is much more complex than that and the function call has a lot more arguments.

items.title: Use ast?
items.body: Using the ast it would be far easier to not make mistakes about if a string is really a string or something else...
